titles.title: Small Business Intermediary Lending Pilot Program Act of 2010
To amend the Small Business Act to establish a small business intermediary lending pilot program.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

term.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary: 5/18/2010--Introduced. Small Business Intermediary Lending Pilot Program Act of 2010 - Establishes a three-year small business intermediary lending pilot program under which the Administrator of the Small Business Administration (SBA) may make direct loans to eligible nonprofit lending intermediaries for the purpose of making loans of up to $200,000 each to startup, newly-established, and growing small businesses. Authorizes the Administrator, under the program, to make one percent, 20-year loans of up to $3 million to up to 20 lending intermediaries.
